title: Italian painting once found on bus stop sells for record $22.3 million
content: Italian Renaissance master Titian's painting, "The Rest on the Flight into Egypt," found in a London bus stop, sold for $22.3 million at Christie’s, surpassing estimates. Depicting Jesus, Mary, and Joseph, the compact masterpiece measures 18.25 x 24.75 inches. Stolen by Napoleonic troops in 1809, it resurfaced after being stolen in 1995. Christie's UK Chairman praised its enduring allure and historical significance.
summary: Italian Renaissance master Titian's painting, "The Rest on the Flight into Egypt," found in a London bus stop, sold for $22.3 million at Christie’s, surpassing estimates. Depicting Jesus, Mary, and Joseph, the compact masterpiece measures 18.25 x 24.75 inches. Stolen by Napoleonic troops in 1809, it resurfaced after being stolen in 1995. Christie's UK Chairman praised its enduring allure and historical significance.

title: Pioneer fire near Washington state lake Chelan escalates level 3 evacuation
content: The Pioneer fire began June 8 near Lake Chelan, Washington, spreading to 7,100 acres with 14% containment, prompting Level 3 evacuations. A state of emergency was declared June 14. Conditions worsened July 4. Level 2 evacuations span Moore Point to Flick Creek, Hazard Creek to Safety Harbor, and Camas Creek to Mitchell Creek, posing significant risks.
summary: The Pioneer fire began June 8 near Lake Chelan, Washington, spreading to 7,100 acres with 14% containment, prompting Level 3 evacuations. A state of emergency was declared June 14. Conditions worsened July 4. Level 2 evacuations span Moore Point to Flick Creek, Hazard Creek to Safety Harbor, and Camas Creek to Mitchell Creek, posing significant risks.

title: Queen expected great-grandchildren to be 'more American' in last meeting, recalls Prince Harry
France is voting in key elections that could see a historic far-right win or a hung parliament
content: Sunday's snap elections in this nuclear-armed nation have potential impact on the war in Ukraine, global diplomacy and Europe's economic stability. And they're almost certain to undercut President Emmanuel Macron for the remaining three years of his presidency.
summary: Sunday's snap elections in this nuclear-armed nation have potential impact on the war in Ukraine, global diplomacy and Europe's economic stability. And they're almost certain to undercut President Emmanuel Macron for the remaining three years of his presidency.

title: Women fight Tokyo election in male-dominated Japan
content: Polls opened Sunday to elect a new Tokyo governor with incumbent Yuriko Koike challenged by opposition figure Renho, two prominent women in Japan's male-dominated political sphere. "I will implement genuine long-term fertility measures," said Renho, who is backed by Japan's main opposition parties.
summary: Polls opened Sunday to elect a new Tokyo governor with incumbent Yuriko Koike challenged by opposition figure Renho, two prominent women in Japan's male-dominated political sphere. "I will implement genuine long-term fertility measures," said Renho, who is backed by Japan's main opposition parties.

title: 1,500-year-old relic linked to Moses and the Ten Commandments discovered in Austria Chapel
content: Archaeologists from Innsbruck University discovered a 1,500-year-old ivory box, or pyx, within a marble shrine under an altar at a chapel on Burgbichl hill in Irschen, Austria. The pyx, adorned with Christian motifs, is tied to the biblical story of Moses receiving the Ten Commandments. Lead archaeologist Gerald Grabherr noted the rarity of such finds, with only around 40 known worldwide. The team also unearthed two Christian churches, a cistern, and personal belongings from the settlement.
summary: Archaeologists from Innsbruck University discovered a 1,500-year-old ivory box, or pyx, within a marble shrine under an altar at a chapel on Burgbichl hill in Irschen, Austria. The pyx, adorned with Christian motifs, is tied to the biblical story of Moses receiving the Ten Commandments. Lead archaeologist Gerald Grabherr noted the rarity of such finds, with only around 40 known worldwide. The team also unearthed two Christian churches, a cistern, and personal belongings from the settlement.

title: 105-year-old woman graduates from Stanford University after 83-year hiatus
Canada police charge Syrian returnee with terrorism offenses
content: Kimberly Polman, 51, charged by Canadian police with terrorism for allegedly joining ISIS in Syria in 2015. Facing two counts under Section 83 of the Criminal Code, she was repatriated in 2022 but not charged until now. The police statement released this information, and her lawyer commented at the time of her repatriation.
summary: Kimberly Polman, 51, charged by Canadian police with terrorism for allegedly joining ISIS in Syria in 2015. Facing two counts under Section 83 of the Criminal Code, she was repatriated in 2022 but not charged until now. The police statement released this information, and her lawyer commented at the time of her repatriation.

title: Sydney house fire kills three children, police suspect homicide
content: In Lalor Park, west of Sydney, a house fire at 1 am killed three children, aged two, four, and 10 months. A 28-year-old man was arrested. Homicide detectives, led by Danny Doherty, are investigating. The children's 29-year-old mother and four other children, aged six to 11, are stable in hospital due to smoke inhalation.
summary: In Lalor Park, west of Sydney, a house fire at 1 am killed three children, aged two, four, and 10 months. A 28-year-old man was arrested. Homicide detectives, led by Danny Doherty, are investigating. The children's 29-year-old mother and four other children, aged six to 11, are stable in hospital due to smoke inhalation.

title: Nato is spending more on defence, but it's likely not enough
MrBeast says 'he will jump in race’ for US Presidency; Here's the requirement he doesn't meet
Imran Khan accused of conspiring to spread anarchy from prison, claims PM's aide
content: Adviser Rana Sanaullah accuses Imran Khan of planning chaos from jail without providing concrete evidence. PTI's rally in Islamabad during Muharram cancelled. Claims of foreign support during 2023 riots. Sanaullah warns of potential destabilization by enemy countries.
summary: Adviser Rana Sanaullah accuses Imran Khan of planning chaos from jail without providing concrete evidence. PTI's rally in Islamabad during Muharram cancelled. Claims of foreign support during 2023 riots. Sanaullah warns of potential destabilization by enemy countries.

title: Texas coast braces for looming hit by Beryl, which is expected to regain hurricane strength
content: Texas warned residents as Tropical Storm Beryl might become a Category 1 hurricane, targeting the coast from Baffin Bay to Sargent. Corpus Christi advised evacuations, using sandbags. Dan Patrick issued a disaster declaration. Beryl caused deaths in the Caribbean; Mexico had none. Matagorda and Refugio County issued evacuation orders during the holiday weekend.
summary: Texas warned residents as Tropical Storm Beryl might become a Category 1 hurricane, targeting the coast from Baffin Bay to Sargent. Corpus Christi advised evacuations, using sandbags. Dan Patrick issued a disaster declaration. Beryl caused deaths in the Caribbean; Mexico had none. Matagorda and Refugio County issued evacuation orders during the holiday weekend.

title: Singapore warns of 'violent splinter cells' after dissolution of JI terror group in Indonesia
content: Singapore's Ministry of Home Affairs cautions about the risk of violent splinter cells emerging after the dissolution of Jemaah Islamiyah. The threat of terrorism in Singapore remains high. Indonesia's JI officially dissolved after years of deadly attacks. Former leaders in detention. Group's history includes links to Al-Qaeda.
summary: Singapore's Ministry of Home Affairs cautions about the risk of violent splinter cells emerging after the dissolution of Jemaah Islamiyah. The threat of terrorism in Singapore remains high. Indonesia's JI officially dissolved after years of deadly attacks. Former leaders in detention. Group's history includes links to Al-Qaeda.

title: Keir Starmer ends Rwanda migrant plan
When Melania Trump said she doesn't need to stand by Donald like Jill
content: ​Melania, according to Trump biographer Michael Wolff, never wanted to Donald Trump to run and she became the most demi-detached First Lady in US history. In 2016 when Trump moved into the White House, Melania initially stayed behind in their New York Trump Tower apartments, before finally heading to Washington in the summer of 2017. At that time, her excuse was Barron was in school and needed her to stay nearby.
summary: ​Melania, according to Trump biographer Michael Wolff, never wanted to Donald Trump to run and she became the most demi-detached First Lady in US history. In 2016 when Trump moved into the White House, Melania initially stayed behind in their New York Trump Tower apartments, before finally heading to Washington in the summer of 2017. At that time, her excuse was Barron was in school and needed her to stay nearby.

title: Meghan McCain asked to shut up on X as her Biden-bashing continues: 'Your father...'
content: Meghan McCain, daughter of former senator late John McCain was asked to shut up on X Saturday as she continued her tirade against Joe Biden and the Biden family. Social media users shared the old photo of Joe Biden comforting Meghan when her father was suffering from brain cancer. "Did Meghan say her father was cognitively incapable? No, she didn't," a user wrote.
summary: Meghan McCain, daughter of former senator late John McCain was asked to shut up on X Saturday as she continued her tirade against Joe Biden and the Biden family. Social media users shared the old photo of Joe Biden comforting Meghan when her father was suffering from brain cancer. "Did Meghan say her father was cognitively incapable? No, she didn't," a user wrote.

title: Catholic Church to pay $76 million to abuse victims in eastern Canada
content: The Catholic Church will pay $104 million to 292 victims of sexual abuse in eastern Canada. Court ruling found Archdiocese of St. John liable for abuse at Mount Cashel Orphanage. Payouts range from $55,000 to $850,000 per victim. Ernst & Young to oversee distribution. Church raises funds by selling buildings.
summary: The Catholic Church will pay $104 million to 292 victims of sexual abuse in eastern Canada. Court ruling found Archdiocese of St. John liable for abuse at Mount Cashel Orphanage. Payouts range from $55,000 to $850,000 per victim. Ernst & Young to oversee distribution. Church raises funds by selling buildings.

title: 'Smitten black girl rejected by Biden': What's the truth behind viral video?
content: ​A video of President Joe Biden ignoring a black woman supporter while merrily moving towards an old white supporter has gone viral with the Republican supporters sharing it and asking Donald Trump to make it his campaign video.
summary: ​A video of President Joe Biden ignoring a black woman supporter while merrily moving towards an old white supporter has gone viral with the Republican supporters sharing it and asking Donald Trump to make it his campaign video.

title: 'Neither fair nor free': US reacts to Iran's presidential poll outcomes
content: The United States has criticized Iran's recent presidential election, describing it as "neither free nor fair" and asserting that electing Masoud Pezeshkian as President will not alter the "Islamic Republic's stance on human rights". Pezeshkian, a reformist candidate, won the runoff election with approximately 53.6% of the vote, defeating ultraconservative Saeed Jalili. A US spokesperson emphasized that despite the election results, the United States intends to continue diplomatic engagements with Tehran "when it advances American interests".
summary: The United States has criticized Iran's recent presidential election, describing it as "neither free nor fair" and asserting that electing Masoud Pezeshkian as President will not alter the "Islamic Republic's stance on human rights". Pezeshkian, a reformist candidate, won the runoff election with approximately 53.6% of the vote, defeating ultraconservative Saeed Jalili. A US spokesperson emphasized that despite the election results, the United States intends to continue diplomatic engagements with Tehran "when it advances American interests".
